channel.title: attack.execution on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.execution on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)

item.title: Enable Microsoft Dynamic Data Exchange
item.description: Enable Dynamic Data Exchange protocol (DDE) in all supported editions of Microsoft Word or Excel.

item.title: Suspicious Add Scheduled Task Parent
item.description: Detects suspicious scheduled task creations from a parent stored in a temporary folder

item.title: Suspicious Dosfuscation Character in Commandline
item.description: Posssible Payload Obfuscation

item.title: Process Start From Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects process start from rare or uncommon folders like temporary folder or folders that usually don’t contain executable files

item.title: BPFtrace Unsafe Option Usage
item.description: Detects the usage of the unsafe bpftrace option

item.title: WMI Uninstall An Application
item.description: Uninstall an application with wmic

item.title: NirCmd Tool Execution
item.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity

item.title: NirCmd Tool Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM
item.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user

item.title: NSudo Tool Execution As System
item.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution

item.title: RunXCmd Tool Execution As System
item.description: Detects the use of RunXCmd tool for command execution

item.title: Code Integrity Blocked Driver Load
item.description: Detects driver load events that got blocked by Windows code integrity checks

item.title: DevInit Lolbin Download
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by devinit.exe lolbin to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system

item.title: NodejsTools PressAnyKey Lolbin
item.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe that can be used to execute any other binary

item.title: False Sysinternals Suite Tools
item.description: Rename as a legitim Sysinternals Suite tools to evade detection

item.title: Shell32 DLL Execution in Suspicious Directory
item.description: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory

item.title: Azure Kubernetes CronJob
item.description: Identifies when a Azure Kubernetes CronJob runs in Azure Cloud. Kubernetes Job is a controller that creates one or more pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate. Kubernetes Job can be used to run containers that perform finite tasks for batch jobs. Kubernetes CronJob is used to schedule Jobs. An Adversary may use Kubernetes CronJob for scheduling execution of malicious code that would run as a container in the cluster.

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes CronJob
item.description: Identifies when a Google Cloud Kubernetes CronJob runs in Azure Cloud. Kubernetes Job is a controller that creates one or more pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate. Kubernetes Job can be used to run containers that perform finite tasks for batch jobs. Kubernetes CronJob is used to schedule Jobs. An Adversary may use Kubernetes CronJob for scheduling execution of malicious code that would run as a container in the cluster.

item.title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Write to System32 Tasks
item.description: Detects the creation of tasks from processes executed from suspicious locations

item.title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Unsecure Level
item.description: Detects use of executionpolicy option to set a unsecure policies

item.title: OMIGOD HTTP No Authentication RCE
item.description: Detects the exploitation of OMIGOD (CVE-2021-38647) which allows remote execute (RCE) commands as root with just a single unauthenticated HTTP request. Verify, successful, exploitation by viewing the HTTP client (request) body to see what was passed to the server (using PCAP). Within the client body is where the code execution would occur. Additionally, check the endpoint logs to see if suspicious commands or activity occurred within the timeframe of this HTTP request.

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript to execute any UNIX/Linux script using the /bin/sh shell. Script being executed gets created as a temp file in /tmp folder with a scx* prefix. Then it is invoked from the following directory /etc/opt/microsoft/scx/conf/tmpdir/. The file in that directory has the same prefix scx*. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteShellCommand
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider Invoke_ExecuteShellCommand to execute any UNIX/Linux command using the /bin/sh shell. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.title: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteShellCommand
item.description: Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider Invoke_ExecuteShellCommand to execute any UNIX/Linux command using the /bin/sh shell. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including Microsoft Operations Manager. Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

item.title: Azure New CloudShell Created
item.description: Identifies when a new cloudshell is created inside of Azure portal.

item.title: Atlassian Confluence CVE-2021-26084
item.description: Detects spawning of suspicious child processes by Atlassian Confluence server which may indicate successful exploitation of CVE-2021-26084

item.title: Created Files by Office Applications
item.description: This rule will monitor executable and script file creation by office applications. Please add more file extensions or magic bytes to the logic of your choice.

item.title: EDR WMI Command Execution by Office Applications
item.description: Initial execution of malicious document calls wmic Win32_Process::Create to execute the file with regsvr32

item.title: Lolbins Process Creation with WmiPrvse
item.description: This rule will monitor LOLBin process creations by wmiprvse. Add more LOLBins to rule logic if needed.

item.title: New Lolbin Process by Office Applications
item.description: This rule will monitor any office apps that spins up a new LOLBin process. This activity is pretty suspicious and should be investigated.

item.title: Possible PrintNightmare Print Driver Install
item.description: Detects the remote installation of a print driver which is possible indication of the exploitation of PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675). The occurrence of print drivers being installed remotely via RPC functions should be rare, as print drivers are normally installed locally and or through group policy.

item.title: Malicious ShellIntel PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names from ShellIntel exploitation scripts.

item.title: Cabinet File Expansion
item.description: Adversaries can use the inbuilt expand utility to decompress cab files as seen in recent Iranian MeteorExpress attack

item.title: Direct Syscall of NtOpenProcess
item.description: Detects the usage of the direct syscall of NtOpenProcess which might be done from a CobaltStrike BOF.

item.title: CobaltStrike Process Patterns
item.description: Detects process patterns found in Cobalt Strike beacon activity (see reference for more details)

item.title: SMB Relay Attack Tools
item.description: Detects different hacktools used for relay attacks on Windows for privilege escalation

item.title: Suspicious MSHTA Process Patterns
item.description: Detects suspicious mshta process patterns

item.title: Regsvr32 Command Line Without DLL
item.description: Detects a regsvr.exe execution that doesn’t contain a DLL in the command line

item.title: PowerShell ADRecon Execution
item.description: Detects execution of ADRecon.ps1 for AD reconnaissance which has been reported to be actively used by FIN7

item.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder

item.title: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.

item.title: Malicious PowerView PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names from PowerView of PowerSploit exploitation framework.

item.description: Detects different process creation events as described in Malwarebytes’s threat report on Lazarus group activity

item.description: Detects different process creation events as described in various threat reports on Lazarus group activity

item.description: Detects Trickbot malware process tree pattern in which rundll32.exe is parent of wermgr.exe

item.description: Detect ed user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline

item.description: Detects WMI executing rundll32

item.description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.

item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Snatch ransomware word document droppers

item.title: DNS RCE CVE-2020-1350
item.description: Detects exploitation of DNS RCE bug reported in CVE-2020-1350 by the detection of suspicious sub process

item.title: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
item.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands

item.title: File Was Not Allowed To Run
item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Space After Filename
item.description: Detects space after filename

item.title: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process which includes bxor command, alternative obfuscation method to b64 encoded commands.

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detected
item.description: Detects all actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines

item.title: Cmd.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
item.description: detects the usage of path traversal in cmd.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: Maze Ransomware
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Maze ransomware word document droppers

item.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

item.description: Detects parameters used by WMImplant

item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.description: Detects the exploitation of Zoho ManageEngine Desktop Central Java Deserialization vulnerability reported as CVE-2020-10189

item.description: Detects Kerberos DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product

item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros

item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

item.title: AWS EC2 Startup Shell Script Change
item.description: Detects changes to the EC2 instance startup script. The shell script will be executed as root/SYSTEM every time the specific instances are booted up.

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros Executing WMI Commands

item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

item.title: Silence.EDA Detection
item.description: Detects Silence empireDNSagent

item.title: Exploiting SetupComplete.cmd CVE-2019-1378
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of privilege escalation vulnerability via SetupComplete.cmd and PartnerSetupComplete.cmd described in CVE-2019-1378

item.title: Service Execution
item.description: Detects manual service execution (start) via system utilities.

item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at powershell.exe with not explorer.exe as a parent.

item.description: Detects remote PowerShell connections by monitoring network outbound connections to ports 5985 or 5986 from a non-network service account.

item.description: Detects remote PowerShell sessions

item.description: Detects non wmiprvse loading WMI modules

item.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

item.description: Detects the use of various web request with commandline tools or Windows PowerShell command,methods (including aliases)

item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.description: Detects Commandlet names and arguments from the Nishang exploitation framework

item.description: Detects new registry key created by Ursnif malware.

item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: Droppers Exploiting CVE-2017-11882
item.description: Detects exploits that use CVE-2017-11882 to start EQNEDT32.EXE and other sub processes like mshta.exe

item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process FLTLDR.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-0261 and CVE-2017-0262

item.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

item.description: Detects a Windows command and scripting interpreter executable started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher and Visio

item.description: Detects a PsExec service start

item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

item.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

item.title: Suspicious RASdial Activity
item.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

item.title: Suspicious WMI Execution
item.description: Detects WMI executing suspicious commands

item.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

item.title: Windows Shell Spawning Suspicious Program
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Windows shell

item.title: WScript or CScript Dropper
item.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

item.title: WSF/JSE/JS/VBA/VBE File Execution
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields
item.description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe

item.title: PowerShell ShellCode
item.description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode

item.title: NTFS Alternate Data Stream
item.description: Detects writing data into NTFS alternate data streams from powershell. Needs Script Block Logging.

item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.description: Detects PowerShell remote thread creation in Rundll32.exe

item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: smbexec.py Service Installation
item.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation

item.title: Elise Backdoor
item.description: Detects Elise backdoor acitivty as used by APT32

item.title: Suspicious Commands Linux
item.description: Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity

item.title: Exploit for CVE-2017-8759
item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process csc.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2017-8759

item.title: APT29
item.description: This method detects a suspicious PowerShell command line combination as used by APT29 in a campaign against U.S. think tanks.

item.title: ZxShell Malware
item.description: Detects a ZxShell start by the called and well-known function name

item.title: PsExec Tool Execution
item.description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events (service and Sysmon)

item.title: PowerShell Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0

item.title: Suspicious Activity in Shell Commands
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various exploit codes (see references)

item.title: Download EXE from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects executable downloads from suspicious remote systems

item.title: Excel Network Connections
item.description: Detects an Excel process that opens suspicious network connections to non-private IP addresses, and attempts to cover CVE-2021-42292. You will likely have to tune this rule for your organization, but it is certainly something you should look for and could have applications for malicious activity beyond CVE-2021-42292.

item.title: PowerShell Network Connections
item.description: Detects a Powershell process that opens network connections - check for suspicious target ports and target systems - adjust to your environment (e.g. extend filters with company’s ip range')

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Generic
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell
item.description: Detecting use WinAPI Functions in PowerShell

item.title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell. Code Injection.
item.description: Detecting Code injection with PowerShell in another process

item.title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework

item.title: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms
item.description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create “shortcuts” to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

item.title: Base64 Encoded Listing of Shadowcopy
item.description: Detects base64 encoded listing Win32_Shadowcopy

item.title: Base64 Encoded Reflective Assembly Load
item.description: Detects base64 encoded .NET reflective loading of Assembly

item.title: CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation
item.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.

item.title: CLR DLL Loaded Via Scripting Applications
item.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an scripting applications

item.title: CobaltStrike BOF Injection Pattern
item.description: Detects a typical pattern of a CobaltStrike BOF which inject into other processes

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement

item.title: CobaltStrike Service Installations in Registry
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement. We can also catch this by system log 7045 (https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/builtin/win_cobaltstrike_service_installs.yml) In some SIEM you can catch those events also in HKLM\System\ControlSet001\Services or HKLM\System\ControlSet002\Services, however, this rule is based on a regular sysmon’s events.

item.title: Covenant Launcher Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
item.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

item.title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution
item.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events

item.title: Cscript Visual Basic Script Execution
item.description: Adversaries may abuse Visual Basic (VB) for execution

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation
item.description: Detects driver load events print service operational log that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation Filename Pattern
item.description: Detects the default filename used in PoC code against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation IPC Access
item.description: Detects remote printer driver load from Detailed File Share in Security logs that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: CVE-2021-26857 Exchange Exploitation
item.description: Detects possible successful exploitation for vulnerability described in CVE-2021-26857 by looking for | abnormal subprocesses spawning by Exchange Server’s Unified Messaging service

item.title: CVE-2021-26858 Exchange Exploitation
item.description: Detects possible successful exploitation for vulnerability described in CVE-2021-26858 by looking for | creation of non-standard files on disk by Exchange Server’s Unified Messaging service | which could indicate dropping web shells or other malicious content

item.title: CVE-2021-40444 Process Pattern
item.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern found in CVE-2021-40444 exploitation

item.title: DarkSide Ransomware Pattern
item.description: Detects DarkSide Ransomware and helpers

item.title: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe
item.description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

item.title: Dllhost Internet Connection
item.description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Dotnet.exe Exec Dll and Execute Unsigned Code LOLBIN
item.description: dotnet.exe will execute any DLL and execute unsigned code

item.title: Download from Suspicious TLD
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts in suspicious TLDs

item.title: Encoded PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in the PowerShell command lines

item.title: Equation Group Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various Equation Group scripts and tools

item.title: Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins Used by HAFNIUM
item.description: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data by HAFNIUM

item.title: Execute Code with Pester.bat
item.description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)

item.title: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe
item.description: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin

item.title: Execution via Diskshadow.exe
item.description: Detects using Diskshadow.exe to execute arbitrary code in text file

item.title: Fireball Archer Install
item.description: Detects Archer malware invocation via rundll32

item.title: Fsutil Behavior Set SymlinkEvaluation
item.description: A symbolic link is a type of file that contains a reference to another file. This is probably done to make sure that the ransomware is able to follow shortcuts on the machine in order to find the original file to encrypt

item.title: GatherNetworkInfo.vbs Script Usage
item.description: Adversaries can abuse of C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs script along with cscript.exe to gather information about the target

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: Hidden Powershell in Link File Pattern
item.description: Detects events that appear when a user click on a link file with a powershell command in it

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: Impacket Lateralization Detection
item.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

item.title: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher
item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher
item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

item.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

item.title: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

item.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

item.title: JexBoss Command Sequence
item.description: Detects suspicious command sequence that JexBoss

item.title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv
item.description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.

item.title: LittleCorporal Generated Maldoc Injection
item.description: Detects the process injection of a LittleCorporal generated Maldoc.

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: MacOS Scripting Interpreter AppleScript
item.description: Detects execution of AppleScript of the macOS scripting language AppleScript.

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlet Names
item.description: Detects the creation of known powershell scripts for exploitation

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets
item.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: Malicious PowerShell Keywords
item.description: Detects keywords from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Execution
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate an execution techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE

item.title: MMC20 Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of “-Embedding” as a child of svchost.exe

item.title: Monitoring Winget For LOLbin Execution
item.description: Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them without touching disk. Winget will be included by default in Windows 10 and is already available in Windows 10 insider programs. The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client. Winget can be used to download and install exe’s, msi, msix files later.

item.title: Monitoring Wuauclt.exe For Lolbas Execution Of DLL
item.description: Adversaries can abuse wuauclt.exe (Windows Update client) to run code execution by specifying an arbitrary DLL.

item.title: MS Office Product Spawning Exe in User Dir
item.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Publisher or Visio

item.title: Mshta Spawning Windows Shell
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a mshta.exe process

item.title: New Application in AppCompat
item.description: A General detection for a new application in AppCompat. This indicates an application executing for the first time on an endpoint.

item.title: PCRE.NET Package Image Load
item.description: Detects processes loading modules related to PCRE.NET package

item.title: PCRE.NET Package Temp Files
item.description: Detects processes creating temp files related to PCRE.NET package

item.title: Possible CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation
item.description: Detects events of driver load errors in print service logs that could be a sign of successful exploitation attempts of print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: PowerShell as a Service in Registry
item.description: Detects that a powershell code is written to the registry as a service.

item.title: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch
item.description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method

item.title: PowerShell Credential Prompt
item.description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: Powershell Execute Batch Script
item.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution. The Windows command shell (cmd) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems. The Windows command prompt can be used to control almost any aspect of a system, with various permission levels required for different subsets of commands. Batch files (ex: .bat or .cmd) also provide the shell with a list of sequential commands to run, as well as normal scripting operations such as conditionals and loops. Common uses of batch files include long or repetitive tasks, or the need to run the same set of commands on multiple system

item.title: Powershell MsXml COM Object
item.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution. PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system. (Citation: TechNet PowerShell) Adversaries can use PowerShell to perform a number of actions, including discovery of information and execution of code

item.title: PowerShell PSAttack
item.description: Detects the use of PSAttack PowerShell hack tool

item.title: PowerShell Remote Session Creation
item.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution. PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system

item.title: Powershell Reverse Shell Connection
item.description: Detects the Nishang Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine reverse shell

item.title: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services
item.description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service

item.title: Powershell XML Execute Command
item.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution. PowerShell is a powerful interactive command-line interface and scripting environment included in the Windows operating system. (Citation: TechNet PowerShell) Adversaries can use PowerShell to perform a number of actions, including discovery of information and execution of code

item.title: PrinterNightmare Mimimkatz Driver Name
item.description: Detects static QMS 810 and mimikatz driver name used by Mimikatz as exploited in CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: Privilege Escalation Preparation
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands indicating the information gathering phase as preparation for the Privilege Escalation.

item.title: ProcessHacker Privilege Elevation
item.description: Detects a ProcessHacker tool that elevated privileges to a very high level

item.title: QBot Process Creation
item.description: Detects QBot like process executions

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Registry Entries For Azorult Malware
item.description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Renamed Powershell Under Powershell Channel
item.description: Detects renamed powershell

item.title: REvil Kaseya Incident Malware Patterns
item.description: Detects process command line patterns and locations used by REvil group in Kaseya incident (can also match on other malware)

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

item.title: Rundll32 Without Parameters
item.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk Ransomware command lines

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Task Deletion
item.description: Detects scheduled task deletion events. Scheduled tasks are likely to be deleted if not used for persistence. Malicious Software often creates tasks directly under the root node e.g. \TASKNAME

item.title: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).

item.title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious script executions in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables

item.title: Silenttrinity Stager Msbuild Activity
item.description: Detects a possible remote connections to Silenttrinity c2

item.title: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection
item.description: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio. Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Suspcious CLR Logs Creation
item.description: Detects suspicious .NET assembly executions. Could detect using Cobalt Strike’s command execute-assembly.

item.title: Suspicious Add Scheduled Task From User AppData Temp
item.description: schtasks.exe create task from user AppData\Local\Temp

item.title: Suspicious Encoded Scripts in a WMI Consumer
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded payloads in WMI Event Consumers

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: Suspicious Execution from Outlook
item.description: Detects EnableUnsafeClientMailRules used for Script Execution from Outlook

item.title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
item.description: Commandline to lauch powershell with a base64 payload

item.title: Suspicious ftp.exe
item.description: Detects renamed ftp.exe, ftp.exe script execution and child processes ran by ftp.exe

item.title: Suspicious LOLBIN AccCheckConsole
item.description: Detects suspicious LOLBIN AccCheckConsole execution with parameters as used to load an arbitrary DLL

item.title: Suspicious Non PowerShell WSMAN COM Provider
item.description: Detects suspicious use of the WSMAN provider without PowerShell.exe as the host application.

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Cmdline
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with reversed strings

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Command Line
item.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Download
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download command

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Reverse Shell Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious shell commands or program code that may be executed or used in command line to establish a reverse shell

item.title: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
item.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

item.title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

item.title: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
item.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious WMI Reconnaissance
item.description: An adversary might use WMI to list Processes running on the compromised host or list installed Software hotfix and patches.

item.title: Suspicious ZipExec Execution
item.description: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.

item.title: Symlink Etc Passwd
item.description: Detects suspicious command lines that look as if they would create symbolic links to /etc/passwd

item.title: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1086 PowerShell Execution
item.description: Detects execution of PowerShell

item.title: TA505 Dropper Load Pattern
item.description: Detects mshta loaded by wmiprvse as parent as used by TA505 malicious documents

item.title: TAIDOOR RAT DLL Load
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Chinese TAIDOOR RAT malware load

item.title: TropicTrooper Campaign November 2018
item.description: Detects TropicTrooper activity, an actor who targeted high-profile organizations in the energy and food and beverage sectors in Asia

item.title: Turla Group Commands May 2020
item.description: Detects commands used by Turla group as reported by ESET in May 2020

item.title: Turla Group Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects automated lateral movement by Turla group

item.title: Turla Group Named Pipes
item.description: Detects a named pipe used by Turla group samples

item.title: UNC2452 PowerShell Pattern
item.description: Detects a specific PowerShell command line pattern used by the UNC2452 actors as mentioned in Microsoft and Symantec reports

item.title: UNC2452 Process Creation Patterns
item.description: Detects a specific process creation patterns as seen used by UNC2452 and provided by Microsoft as Microsoft Defender ATP queries

item.title: Unidentified Attacker November 2018
item.description: A sigma rule detecting an unidetefied attacker who used phishing emails to target high profile orgs on November 2018. The Actor shares some TTPs with YYTRIUM/APT29 campaign in 2016.

item.title: Ursnif Malware C2 URL Pattern
item.description: Detects Ursnif C2 traffic.

item.title: Using AppVLP To Circumvent ASR File Path Rule
item.description: Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. We are able to abuse “AppVLP” to execute shell commands. Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but we can use it as an abuse binary to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder or to mark a file as a system file.

item.title: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin
item.description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary

item.title: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

item.title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN
item.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)

item.title: WMI Event Consumer Created Named Pipe
item.description: Detects the WMI Event Consumer service scrcons.exe creating a named pipe

item.title: WMI Reconnaissance List Remote Services
item.description: An adversary might use WMI to check if a certain Remote Service is running on a remote device. When the test completes, a service information will be displayed on the screen if it exists. A common feedback message is that “No instance(s) Available” if the service queried is not running. A common error message is “Node - (provided IP or default) ERROR Description =The RPC server is unavailable” if the provided remote host is unreacheable

item.title: WMI Spawning Windows PowerShell
item.description: Detects WMI spawning PowerShell

item.title: WMIExec VBS Script
item.description: Detects suspicious file execution by wscript and cscript

item.title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network and loading it for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: WSL Execution
item.description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN
